metadata.title: CVE-2019-15903 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In libexpat before 2.2.8, crafted XML input could fool the parser intochanging from DTD parsing to document parsing too early; a consecutive callto XML_GetCurrentLineNumber (or XML_GetCurrentColumnNumber) then resultedin a heap-based buffer over-read.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15903` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.7-2
libexpat1 - 2.2.7-2
No subscription required

firefox - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

chromium-browser - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libxmltok1t64 - 1.2-4.1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.7-2').
xmlrpc-c package in oracular is affected and needs fixing.
wbxml2 package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
matanza: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
tdom package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
firefox package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '70.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1').
chromium-browser package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu1').
libxmltok package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-4.1ubuntu3.1').
